num_tested_probands.text: The three probands of the three unrelated families were referred to DCRU because of prolonged duration of action of succinylcholine.
The text mentions that some members had died and genotyping was not possible, suggesting that there may be additional individuals who underwent genetic testing.

num_positive_het_probands.text: The text states that the proband in family 1 was heterozygous for BCHE*115D/I3E4-14C/BCHE*FS126, and the proband in family 3 was compound heterozygous for BCHE*328D and BCHE*142M. However, it does not explicitly state that these individuals are single-allele (monoallelic) pathogenic carriers.

positive_phenotypes.text: The text states that the proband in family 1 had BChE activity below detection limit and experienced an extensively prolonged duration of action of succinylcholine. This suggests that this individual has a positive phenotype, but the exact phenotype is not specified.

num_compound_or_double_hets.text: The text states that the proband in family 3 was compound heterozygous for BCHE*328D and BCHE*142M. This suggests that there is at least one individual who has two different pathogenic variants in the same gene.
